It speaks to the sheer resilience of Native peoples that they endured this trauma.

The Senate Committee on Indian Affairs passed the Truth and Healing Commission on Indian Boarding Policy Act. It‚Äôs a step towards providing long overdue answers to Native communities.

Denise Lajimodiere grew up hearing stories of her parents‚Äô traumatic experiences at these boarding schools. Children were beaten, locked in closets, and punished for things like speaking their Native language.

The mission? Erasing their cultural heritage.
https://www.mprnews.org/story/2019/10/03/stories-of-life-in-indian-boarding-schools

The boarding school system deployed systematic, militarized methods to assimilate Indigenous children.
